Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Topical Tranexamic Acid in Mastectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: two-centre, stratified, parallel-group, placebo-controlled, double-blind randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing mastectomy with or without axillary lymph node clearance. Conducted at St Olav's University Hospital and Ålesund Hospital

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to receive either 25 mg/ml TXA or 0.9% sodium chloride (placebo)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine if moistening a surgical wound with tranexamic acid (TXA) before closure reduces postoperative bleeding in mastectomy patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative bleeding measured by drain production in the first 24 hours.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From January 2016 to August 2018, 208 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 202 included in the analysis (101 TXA, 101 placebo) using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: TXA significantly reduced mean drain production at 24 hours (110 ml vs. 144 ml; mean difference 34 ml, 95% CI 8 to 60; p = 0.011).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the involved institutions.
